name: The Phoenix (SaF)
resistance: radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Born of Fire
traits.desc: The phoenix radiates sunlight in a 60-foot radius and dim light in a further 180- foot radius.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The phoenix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: The Fire Is Alive
traits.desc: At the start of each of its turns, the phoenix regains 3d12 hit points.

traits.name: Dazzling Plumage
traits.desc: The phoenix’s feathers cycle through every color in the rainbow. Any evil creature that begins its turn within 60 feet of the Defender of All the Earth and does not avert its gaze must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn. Charmed targets are stunned. If a target’s saving throw is successful, it is immune to the phoenix’s Dazzling Plumage for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phoenix makes two talon attacks and one bite attack.

actions.name: Talon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Light of All Colors (Recharge 4–6)
actions.desc: The phoenix exhales a beam of brilliant, prismatic light in a line that is 10 feet wide and 1,000 feet long. Each creature in that line must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) fire and 35 (10d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In battle, the phoenix is a unit with Attack +17 and Power +15 and can affect every unit in the battle.
